definition: to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)
to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: A young policeman has been accused of conspiring with a gang of criminals.
sentences.chinese: 一名年轻警察被指控与一个犯罪集团相勾结。

sentences.english: All the while, Ping was learning about the "snakehead" organised crime group that owned her.
sentences.chinese: 渐渐地，刘平了解了拥有她的蛇头组织犯罪集团。

sentences.english: Throughout the year, the fight against triads and organised criminal syndicates continued.
sentences.chinese: 年内，警方继续打击三合会及有组织犯罪集团。

sentences.english: This company is associated with an east-coast organized syndicate.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司同东海岸的一个犯罪集团有联系。

definition: bunch of gangsters/criminal gang/organized crime syndicate
(of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
to uncover (a criminal plot)/to break open and capture
to commit a crime or offence
to investigate (as detective)/to solve (crime)/to uncover (a plot)/to sniff out/to break in and analyze/detective work/to scout
